info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:58AM EST until January 11 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. Dan River at Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. Dan River near Danville affecting Pittsylvania, City of Danville, Caswell and Rockingham independent cities. .Very heavy rain fell across the region Tuesday into early Wednesday. Excessive runoff into the lower portion of the Dan and the Roanoke River basins continues and will for another day or two in most cases. For the Roanoke River...including Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including South Boston, Dan River at Paces, STP near Danville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Dan River near STP near Danville. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect Riverside shopping center. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST this morning the stage was 22.8 feet. Flood stage is 21.0 feet. The river is near crest and is expected to begin a slow fall this afternoon. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - The river crested earlier today at 22.9 ft and has begun to fall slowly. The stage at 800 am EST this morning was 22.8 ft. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling slowly through the weekend barring any additional heavy rainfall. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - For additional information, please visit our web site at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Minor flooding is occurring and will continue along the lower portion of the Dan and Roanoke rivers. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For additional information please visit our web site at www.weather.gov/blacksburg. this afternoon at 200 PM EST.
